section.description: Alpha Anywhere provides the following Browse methods based on the default BROWSE object.

case.title: .ARCHIVE
case.description: Prints Layout_Name to file in the .PDF format.

case.title: .DELETE()
case.description: Deletes the browse from disk.

case.title: .DIALOG()
case.description: Opens Form_Name as a dialog box.

case.title: .LOAD()
case.description: Loads Browse Name into memory and returns an object pointer.

case.title: .PREVIEW()
case.description: Displays the browse and the selected records in the Print Preview dialog.

case.title: .PRINT()
case.description: Obsolete, see PRINT_BROWSE(). .PRINT()previews the print formatted browse on the screen.

case.title: .SAVEAS()
case.description: Prints the browse to file in the specified format. If no format is specified, the .PDF format is used.

case.title: .VIEW()
case.description: Opens Browse Name and returns an object pointer.

case.title: .VIEWQUERIED()
case.description: Opens Browse Name and returns an object pointer.

case.title: .WINDOW_POSITION()
case.description: Positions a browse window on the screen.

section.description: Alpha Anywhere provides the following browse methods. The use of these methods requires the pointer returned by the BROWSE.LOAD() method.

case.title: ACTIVATE()
case.description: Sets focus to the browse.

case.title: .ACTIVE()
case.description: Returns the name of the column with focus.

case.title: .ACTIVE_DRILLDOWN()
case.description: Returns the column that has deepest focus.

case.title: .ACTIVE_PREV()
case.description: Returns the name of the column which previously had focus.

case.title: .ALLOW_CHANGE()
case.description: Sets the Allow Changes flag for a form or browse. When the flag is .T., data can be edited.

case.title: .ALLOWCHANGESTATUS()
case.description: Returns .T. (TRUE) if the layout allows editing; otherwise, it returns .F. (FALSE).

case.title: .ARCHIVE()
case.description: Prints Layout_Name to file in the .PDF format.

case.title: .BASEQUERYRUN()
case.description: Sets the base filter and order expressions for a layout.

case.title: .CANCEL()
case.description: Cancels any changes made to the current record before the records is saved.

case.title: .CHANGE_MODE()
case.description: Put a browse layout into change mode, just as if the user had done so by beginning to type into any field.

case.title: .CHILD()
case.description: Returns a pointer to the specified child object.

case.title: .CHILD_ENUM()
case.description: Returns a CR-LF separated list of all the child objects on the browse, in tab order.

case.title: .CHILDREN()
case.description: Returns the number of objects that a browse object contains.

case.title: .CLASS()
case.description: Returns the class (i.e., type) of the object.

case.title: .CLOSE()
case.description: Closes the form or browse window.

case.title: .COMMIT()
case.description: Saves the current record.

case.title: .COPY_PREV_FIELD()
case.description: Copies the value from the corresponding field in the previous record into the current field.

case.title: .COPY_PREV_RECORD()
case.description: Copies values from the previous record into the current record.

case.title: .CURRENT_RECORD()
case.description: Returns the record number of the current browse row.

case.title: .CURSOR_GET()
case.description: Returns the character position of the cursor.

case.title: .CURSOR_SET()
case.description: Places the cursor at the specified character Position.

case.title: .DATA_ENTRY_STYLE()
case.description: Returns the window mode of the layout.

case.title: .DELETE_RECORD()
case.description: Deletes the current record in a form or a browse.

case.title: .DIAL_PHONE()
case.description: Dials the phone number in the column and row that currently has focus.

case.title: .DICTIONARY_GET()
case.description: Returns the name of the dictionary file that contains the browse.

case.title: .DISABLE()
case.description: Makes an object unable to receive focus. May also gray the object. Works with forms, browses, fields, buttons, check boxes, etc.

case.title: .DOWN()
case.description: Moves the focus down as if the user had pressed the Down key.

case.title: .DUPLICATE_RECORD()
case.description: Creates a new record that is a duplicate of the current record and then moves focus to the new record.

case.title: .ENABLE()
case.description: Makes an object able to receive focus. Works with forms, browses, fields, buttons, check boxes, etc.

case.title: .END()
case.description: Moves the focus to the end of the row as if the user had pressed the End key.

case.title: .EVAL()
case.description: Interprets a character string as an Xbasic expression.

case.title: .FETCH_FIRST()
case.description: Moves to the first record in the current query.

case.title: .FETCH_LAST()
case.description: Moves to the last record in the current query. Works with forms and browses.

case.title: .FETCH_NEXT()
case.description: Moves to the next record in the current query.

case.title: .FETCH_PREV()
case.description: Moves to the previous record in the current query. Works with forms and browses.

case.title: .FILTER_GET()
case.description: Returns the current filter expression for the layout.

case.title: .FIND()
case.description: Does a Find by Key for value. If value is not specified, the built-in Find dialog is displayed.

case.title: .FIND_AND_REPLACE()
case.description: Displays the Find and Replace dialog box. If layout has the Change mode restricted, then only the Find tab is shown.

case.title: .FINDBY_DEFINEDKEY()
case.description: A high level approach to displaying the Find by Key dialog box that allows you to customize its appearance and preset its filter.

case.title: .FORM_VIEW()
case.description: Toggles a browse window into a form window.

case.title: .GETACTIVEOBJPARENT()
case.description: Returns a pointer to the container of the object that has focus.

case.title: .HAS_METHOD()
case.description: Returns .T. (TRUE) if the browse supports the named method.

case.title: .HIDE()
case.description: Hides an object.

case.title: .HOME()
case.description: Moves the focus to the beginning of the row as if the user had pressed the Home key.

case.title: .ICON_GET()
case.description: Returns the filename of the browse icon.

case.title: .INDEX_NAME()
case.description: Returns the name of the current primary index or query.

case.title: .INDEX_POINTER()
case.description: Returns a pointer to the current primary index or query.

case.title: .INDEX_SET()
case.description: Selects an index or query list as the primary index for a form or browse.

case.title: .INDEX_SETEXPLICIT()
case.description: Sets the primary index for the browse.

case.title: .IndexSetDialog()
case.description: Displays the Primary Index or Query dialog box.

case.title: .IS_ON_LAST_OBJECT()
case.description: Returns .T. (TRUE) if the object is the last object on the browse, as specified in the browse's tab order.

case.title: .ISVISIBLE()
case.description: Returns .T. (TRUE) if the browse is visible.

case.title: .KINDOF()
case.description: Returns the kind of object represented by a browse.

case.title: .LEFT()
case.description: Moves the focus to the left as if the user had pressed the Left key.

case.title: .LOCATE()
case.description: Displays the Locate dialog box.

case.title: .LOCATE_NEXT()
case.description: Finds the next record with a field value matching value. If field is not specified, all fields are searched. Otherwise, only the specified field is searched.

case.title: .LOCATE_PREV()
case.description: Finds the previous record with a field value matching value. If field is not specified, all fields are searched. Otherwise, only the specified field is searched.

case.title: .MARK_RECORD()
case.description: Marks the current record.

case.title: .MAXIMIZE()
case.description: Maximizes the browse window.

case.title: .MENUITEMCHECK()
case.description: Displays or removes a checkmark next to a menu entry.

case.title: .MENUITEMENABLE()
case.description: Enables or disables (grays) a menu entry.

case.title: .MENUITEMRESET()
case.description: Enables and removes any checkmarks from a menu entry.

case.title: .MINIMIZE()
case.description: Minimizes the browse window.

case.title: .MODE_GET()
case.description: returns the current mode of the layout. Possible modes are: VIEW, CHANGE, ENTER, QUERY and FIND.

case.title: .MULTI_SELECT()
case.description: Displays the Multi-Select Records dialog box.

case.title: .NAME()
case.description: Returns the browse's name.

case.title: .NAVIGATOR()
case.description: Displays the Goto which field? dialog box.

case.title: .NEW_RECORD()
case.description: Enters a new record into a browse.

case.title: .NEXT()
case.description: Moves the focus to the next control in the tab order as if the user had pressed the Tab key.

case.title: .ORDER_GET()
case.description: Returns the current order expression for the browse.

case.title: .OUPUT_FILE_OVERRIDE()
case.description: Sets the name of the file to be printed. It returns the name, if any, of the file currently set to be printed.

case.title: .PREV()
case.description: Moves the focus to the previous control in the tab order as if the user had pressed the Shift-Tab key.

case.title: .PRINTER_OVERRIDE()
case.description: Sets the printer configuration, and optionally, saves the current configuration before overwriting it.

case.title: .QUERY_BY_EXPN()
case.description: Displays the Query by Expression dialog.

case.title: .QUERY_BY_TABLE()
case.description: Opens the Query by Table dialog.

case.title: .QUERY_GENIE()
case.description: Displays the Query Genie dialog box.

case.title: .QUERYRUN()
case.description: Applies a query to the current browse.

case.title: .QUICK_EXPORT()
case.description: Exports the currently selected records to Excel.

case.title: . QUICK_SEARCH()
case.description: Performs the same action as the Quick Filter command.

case.title: .QUICK_SEARCHEXCL()
case.description: Opposite of the .QUICK_SEARCH() methods. Finds all records that do NOT match the value in the current control.

case.title: .QUICK_SORT()
case.description: Performs the same action as the Quick Sort command. Works with forms and browses.

case.title: .QUICKFILTER()
case.description: Returns a count of the matching records, as if you had clicked the Quick Filter icon.

case.title: .QUICK_SEARCH()
case.description: Performs the same action as the Quick Filter command and finds all records that match the value in the current control.

case.title: .QUICK_SEARCHEXCL()
case.description: performs the opposite action as the Quick Filter command and finds all records that do NOT match the value in the current control.

case.title: .QUICKSORTEXPLICIT()
case.description: Sorts the table or set on the indicated field and then displays it in the current browse.

case.title: .QUICKSORTMULTIFLD()
case.description: Displays the Custom Sort dialog box.

case.title: .QUICKSRCHEXPLICIT()
case.description: Filters the records in a browse based on the value of a field.

case.title: .QUICKSRCHMULTIFLD()
case.description: Displays the multi-field Quick Filter dialog.

case.title: .RECORDS_GET()
case.description: Returns the number of records displayed by the layout.

case.title: .REFERENCE_EXPRESSION_GET()
case.description: Returns the reference expression to reconstruct a reference to the object.

case.title: .REFRESH()
case.description: Forces the browse to re-fetch data from its data source, and then to repaint itself. Works with all controls. Note, this method does not re-query the table to see if the record content of the browse has changed.

case.title: .REFRESH_BROWSE()
case.description: Refreshes the browse, as if you had pressed Browse > Refresh Display.

case.title: .REFRESH_FIELDS()
case.description: Executes the .REFRESH() method on each cell on a browse.

case.title: .REFRESH_LAYOUT()
case.description: Refreshes the browse, as if you had pressed Browse > Refresh Display.

case.title: .RESTORE()
case.description: Restores a minimized or maximized window to normal size.

case.title: .RESYNCH()
case.description: Requeries the table, re-fetches all data for the form, and repaints the form.

case.title: .RIGHT()
case.description: Moves the focus to the right as if the user had pressed the Right key.

case.title: .RIGHTCLICK()
case.description: Displays the Right Click menu.

case.title: .RUN_SAVED_QUERY()
case.description: Runs a saved query. If Query_Name is not specified, Alpha Anywhere prompts for a name.

case.title: .SELECT_TEXT()
case.description: Selects text in the current field from Start_Position for Length characters.

case.title: .SELECTED_RECORDS()
case.description: Returns a list of the currently selected record numbers.

case.title: .SEND()
case.description: Emails the browse.

case.title: .SESSIONHANDLE()
case.description: Returns the session handle associated with the object.

case.title: .SET_DIRTY()
case.description: Indicates that layout needs to be saved.

case.title: .IndexSetDialog()
case.description: Displays the Select

case.title: .SHOW()
case.description: Shows an object that may previously have been hidden using the .HIDE() method. Works with forms, browses, fields, buttons, check boxes, text, lines and most other objects on forms.

case.title: .SHOW_ALL()
case.description: Turns off the current query and shows all records in the table (subject to any base filter that may have been specified in the form or browses Filter/Order properties).

case.title: .SHOW_MEMO()
case.description: Opens the memo editor for a memo field. Works with forms and browses.

case.title: .SPECIALQUERIES()
case.description: Displays the Select Filter dialog box.

case.title: .SPELL_CHECK()
case.description: Displays the object specified by and the Spellchecker dialog box.

case.title: .TABLE_GET()
case.description: Returns the object pointer to the table that contains the data on the browse.

case.title: .TOGGLE_FORMBROWSE()
case.description: Switches the browse to a form display.

case.title: .TOOLBARCHANGE()
case.description: Loads and displays the selected toolbar.

case.title: .ToolbarControlEnable()
case.description: Enables or disables the specified item on the control bar.

case.title: .TYPE()
case.description: Returns the type of data bound to an browse.

case.title: .UNMARK_RECORD()
case.description: Un-marks the current record.

case.title: .UP()
case.description: Moves the focus up as if the user had pressed the Up key.

case.title: .VARIABLES()
case.description: Returns a pointer to a dot variable that contains the values of the selected variables.

case.title: .WINDOW_POSITION()
case.description: Sets the location of the browse on the screen.

case.title: .ZORDER()
case.description: Sets the stacking position of a browse.

section.description: The following functions and methods are useful for manipulating browses.

case.title: A5.BROWSE_ENUM()
case.description: Returns a list of browses.

case.title: A5.BROWSE_LOCATION()
case.description: Returns the name of the file that contains the browse.

case.title: A5_BROWSE_CREATE()
case.description: Displays the New Browse dialog, which allows you to select the fields that will appear in the new browse.

case.title: A5_LAYOUT_DESIGN()
case.description: Opens the named layout in the appropriate editor.

case.title: A5_OPEN_DEFAULT_BROWSE()
case.description: Opens the default browse for the specified table.

case.title: ADHOCVIEW()
case.description: Creates a temporary browse or form for the table or set defined by a provided table or set name. The resulting layout can be user modifiable or locked to prevent user modifications.

case.title: ALLOW_EDITING()
case.description: Returns the current setting of the Form > Allow Edits, or Browse > Allow Edits menu command.

case.title: BROWSE_OBJECTS_GET()
case.description: Returns a list of the columns on a browse.

case.title: CLOSE_IF_EXISTS()
case.description: Closes a browse if it is open.

case.title: CURRENT_HIGHLIGHTED_RECORDS()
case.description: Returns the rows currently highlighted in a browse.

case.title: LAYOUT_DELETE()
case.description: Deletes the named Form, Browse, Label, Letter, or Report.

case.title: LAYOUT_RENAME()
case.description: Renames or copies the named Form, Browse, Label, Letter, or Report.

case.title: PREVIEW_BROWSE()
case.description: Previews the browse as it would appear if printed.

case.title: PRINT_BROWSE()
case.description: Creates the selected browse and then displays the Print dialog box.
